title: Student Outcomes | Student Financial Aid and Scholarships | University of Illinois at Chicago
contents: Skip to the content of this page ,  the main menu , the secondary menu , the site search form , the site home page .           Student Financial Aid and Scholarships     Search the site     Toggle Menu      Search                  Student Financial Aid and Scholarships      Student Financial Aid and Scholarships   Main Menu    Cost           Cost of Attendance (COA)    Estimating EFC    Financial Need    Paying Your Bill         Financial Aid Steps           Illinois RISE Act    Eligibility    Apply    Verification    Financial Aid Notification    Payment    Summer Financial Aid    SAP Policy & Appeal    Special Circumstances    Rights & Responsibilities    Withdrawing vs. Reducing Hours    FERPA    Calendar         Types of Aid           Grants    Scholarships    Waivers & Assistantships    Loans    Student Employment    Study Abroad    Veterans    Pre-paid Tuition         Forms           2019-2020 Forms    2020-2021 Forms         FAQ           Glossary of Terms    Contact Us         Consumer Information           Academic Programs    Department of Education Complaint Process    Financial Aid Information    Semester Withdrawals    General Institutional Information    Health, Safety and Security    Intercollegiate Athletic Program Participation Rates and Financial Support Data    Student Outcomes    Voter Registration    Notice of Availability of Institutional and Financial Aid Information    Contact Information for Assistance in Obtaining Institutional or Financial Aid Information          Eyebrow menu    Scholarships    UIC Connection    Student Affairs    UIC menu    UIC.edu    Campus Map       Search                      Student Outcomes      View Menu           Breadcrumbs   Student Financial Aid and Scholarships    Consumer Information    Student Outcomes        Student Outcomes (graduation Rates, Retention Rate, Assessment of Student Learning)   College Scorecard – The College Scorecard is provided by the U.S. Department of Education and details Costs, Graduation Rate, Loan Default Rate and Median Borrowing for UIC students.  Graduation Rates – Provides six-year graduation rate of certificate or degree-seeking, first-time, full-time undergraduate students.  Graduation Rates for Students Receiving Athletically Related Student Aid (NCAA) – Provides information for degree-seeking first-time, full-time undergraduates who received athletically related student aid.  Post-Graduation Information – The institution does not calculate placement rates or advertise job placement rates as a means of recruiting students. Additionally, it does not advertise the types of graduate and professional education in which graduates of the institution's 4-year degree programs enroll. Listed below are optional surveys which gather some of this information.  Employment Data and Acceptance into Further Study Data  Job Placement for Doctoral Programs    Retention Rate  Retention rate of degree seeking, first-time, undergraduate students  Time to Degree/Attrition Rate for Doctoral Program Students    Student Assessment Campus Information  Degree Program Learning Outcome Assessment Results  Teacher Preparation Program Report – Pre-service teacher license assessment pass rates  Undergraduate General Education Outcome Assessment Results             Consumer Information           Academic Programs    Department of Education Complaint Process    Financial Aid Information    Semester Withdrawals    General Institutional Information    Health, Safety and Security    Intercollegiate Athletic Program Participation Rates and Financial Support Data    Student Outcomes    Voter Registration    Notice of Availability of Institutional and Financial Aid Information    Contact Information for Assistance in Obtaining Institutional or Financial Aid Information
